definition: (idiom) full of vitality/relaxed and alert
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
bright/clear/crisp/open/frank/straightforward/to feel well/fine/pleasurable/invigorating/to deviate

sentences.english: Now he felt the cool breeze that was blowing in this part of the Maze and it was refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 這時，從迷宮中吹來習習的涼風，使人感到神清氣爽。

sentences.english: Refreshing and stimulating, it wakes you up with a pleasure of enjoyng the rich, heady taste.
sentences.chinese: 濃郁醇厚的味道，讓你神清氣爽，精力充沛。

sentences.english: Chrysanthemum from Huangshan Moutain brings you a refreshed day.
sentences.chinese: 黃山的精品菊花，給你帶來一天的神清氣爽。

sentences.english: When you awaken from REM sleep, you’ll feel refreshed and alert.
sentences.chinese: 當你從眼動睡眠中被喚醒的話，你會感覺到神清氣爽。

sentences.english: You will feel better and save money.
sentences.chinese: 你會覺得更神清氣爽，而且很省錢。

sentences.english: White desk and bookcase, qing Dynasty of god making a person enrages bright.
sentences.chinese: 白色的書桌和書櫃，令人神清氣爽。

sentences.english: Autumn. The air is light and summer`s humid heat is fading.
sentences.chinese: 秋天，空氣使人神清氣爽，夏季的溼熱正漸漸退去。

sentences.english: When he was refreshed with food and sleep, he contemplated his journey again.
sentences.chinese: 當他喫飽睡夠，神清氣爽，便可以再考慮他的行程。

definition: lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
happy/entirely free from worry
unpleasant smell/stink
nice and warm
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to tease/to poke fun at
to be full (after eating)
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
full of vigor (idiom)/lively/in high spirits
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
dull/insipid
